CatDescriptText: George Varadi, waiter, Hazelwood and Harlan Warren, high school student, Sheraden, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 13, 1960, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that married students of high school age should be permitted to attend school with other students who are single?"  George Varadi's answer reads: "Yes, because it would lead to harmony and great understanding."  Harlan Warran's answer reads: "Yes, because they are in as much need of education as the rest of the youths."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of George Varadi wearing fedora with dark band and overcoat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Downtown; Portrait of Harlan Warren wearing eyeglasses, hat with woven band, and light colored mohair overcoat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
